lines.text:
[when finding out that Mrs. Skof's death was not an accident]
Every murderer makes a mistake. This one made two.
Do you see what it says on that picture on the wall?

[reads]
God sees everything!
That's what they say, that's what they say! A police officer can't see everything, but he is able to see something. Or at least he should be! What time it is?
They boys have already read the morning paper. There is a phone over there. Alert the murder squad!
[Virta rushes to the phone]
. Every murderer makes a mistake, this one made two.

[on the phone]
Hey, boys! Come here! Mrs. Scrof, Rantakatu 2! Bye!
[to Palmu]
They are coming! The murderers... I mean the murder squad!

God timing! I'm sure that you noticed everything right away! The dog has been lifted on the mattres. That was the first mistake! If the dog had felt the odor of the gas, it would have go around the room and finally hide itself under the bed in panic. Besides, its neck is broken.
Really?
Yes. Maybe it attacted the murderer and he snuffed it out. The second mistake is the over-boiled porrige. Why wasn't the stove cleaned.
Maybe Mrs. Scrof planned to do it in the morning.
This woman was very tidy! The kettle is out of its place. Who has touched the kettle?
I told you right away that it is a murder!
Oh, you did? Well, you are undergraduate after all!
Where were you last night between 11pm and 12pm?
Me? I was at my club. I left after 12 pm.
What is the name of your club?
The Silent Pole Vaulters Club.

[to the murderer]
It is true that you forgot that God sees everything, isn't?

[voiceover]
Of course it was a murder. Otherwise they wouldn't call the Criminal Investigation Police. And no-one forgets to switch off the gas.
It was not a murder.
I didn't say anything like that.
No, but you THOUGHT!
If Inspector had even a little bit of imagination...
...I would cut it off. Or leave my job.
[Kokki's first lines]
The murder squad has arrived, sir.
I smell the odor of gas.
What?
At the stairs! I smell the odor of gas at the stairs.
Gas! No, it is not the odor of gas!
[to his wife]
Or did you smell it?
No, it is just the drainpipes that are broken.
No, I'm sure that it is the odor of gas.
That old woman, that old woman upstairs. She doesn't have the drainpipes repaired, because she is so stingy.
What ever you say, this is the smell of gas!
By the way, where were you yesterday-evening from eleven o'clock to twelve o'clock?
Well... I was at my club. I left there after twelve o'clock.
What is the name of your club?
The club of the quiet pole jumpers.
